summary: Fixed MSVC build breaks caused by mnemonic-but-invalid hex seed salts in ambient biolum particles and floor-border overlays.
Introduced a convenient compile-time hashed tag literal (`"..."_tag`) for readable, domain-separated procedural RNG salting (built on existing FNV-1a tag hashing).
Refactored the affected salting callsites to use the new `_tag` literal (removing the risk of future invalid hex typos).
notes: The MSVC error C3688 ('invalid literal suffix') was triggered because tokens like `0xB10L1234u` / `0xB0RD3Ru` contain non-hex digits (L/R), so the compiler interprets them as malformed numeric literals with a suffix.
Using compile-time hashed string tags avoids brittle 'cute' hex mnemonics while keeping salts readable and deterministic across platforms.
